entry.title: Fiori Elements / Flexible Programming Model Value Help Custom Filter
entry.content:
Hi,

we're using a Standard Value Help in our FPM app (V4 with RAP) with the Valuehelp annotation

 

 @ui.selectionField: [{ position: 20 }]
     @EndUserText.label: 'Artikel'
     @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{ 
        entity: { name: '/LUNEH/BC_CIP_SHLP_ARTICLE', element: 'Article' },
        additionalBinding: [{ localElement: 'StoreId', usage: #FILTER, element: 'StoreId' }]
     }]
     Article;

 

However we would like to create a custom Filter (Checkbox) in this Value Help. Is this possible?

Currently we are creating Custom filters like this: https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/sdk/#/topic/5fb9f57fcf12401bbe39a635e9a32a4e

But I do not see a way to apply this to the Value Help. Any input is much appreciated!

cf. https://me.sap.com/privcloudlandscape/system/500487970/visualization#?variant=standard

 

Did someone have a similar issue ?

Thanks for support,

NBT

entry.title: @cap-js/mcp-server - Practical guide to get value on day on
entry.content:
Give your coding assistant instant, project‑aware knowledge of your CAP model and docs. With @cap-js/mcp-server, the assistant can look up entities, services, fields, and HTTP endpoints from your compiled CDS model and cross‑check official CAP docs, so it proposes the right code and changes in your editor.

Here's where I found this and would like to share with community - https://github.com/cap-js/mcp-server

  • Package: @cap-js/mcp-server
  • Command: cds-mcp
  • Tools: search_model (compiled CDS/CSN), search_docs (local CAP docs embeddings)
  • Works with MCP‑capable assistants in VS Code and other IDEs (e.g., Cline, Copilot Agent Mode, opencode)

Here’s the short version - just follow these 3 step

  1. Configure your IDE agent to start the server via npx:
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "cds-mcp": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["-y", "@cap-js/mcp-server"],
      "env": {}
    }
  }
}
  1. Add these rules to AGENTS.md so the assistant always uses the server correctly:
- You MUST search for CDS definitions, like entities, fields and services (which include HTTP endpoints) with cds-mcp, only if it fails you MAY read *.cds files in the project.
- You MUST search for CAP docs with cds-mcp EVERY TIME you create, modify CDS models or when using APIs or the `cds` CLI from CAP. Do NOT propose, suggest or make any changes without first checking it.
  1. Optional CLI smoke test:
npm i -g @cap-js/mcp-server
cds-mcp search_model . Books entity
cds-mcp search_docs "how to add columns to a select statement in CAP Node.js" 1

Why you’ll love it

  • Stop guessing: Fuzzy‑search your compiled model for entities, services, elements, annotations, and endpoints.
  • Fewer mistakes: Suggestions are grounded in your actual model and verified against official CAP docs.
  • All local: Fast and private, perfect for day‑to‑day development.

IDE setup

VS Code - Cline extension

Settings example:

{
  "mcpServers": {
    "cds-mcp": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["-y", "@cap-js/mcp-server"],
      "env": {}
    }
  }
}

VS Code - GitHub Copilot Agent Mode (global mcp.json)

{
  "servers": {
    "cds-mcp": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["-y", "@cap-js/mcp-server"],
      "env": {},
      "type": "stdio"
    },
    "inputs": []
  }
}

opencode

{
  "mcp": {
    "cds-mcp": {
      "type": "local",
      "command": ["npx", "-y", "@cap-js/mcp-server"],
      "enabled": true
    }
  }
}

Tip: Keep the server name “cds-mcp” in both your config and prompts so your assistant reliably calls it.

How to use it in your editor

Think “discover first, then change.” Ask your assistant to:

  • Discover model and endpoints

    • “Use cds‑mcp search_model to list all services and their HTTP endpoints. Then list entities with primary keys.”

  • Write a correct SELECT with expand

    • “Call cds‑mcp search_model for Books and its associations. Then, after checking CAP Node.js SELECT expand syntax via cds‑mcp search_docs, propose a handler that returns Books.title, Books.stock and expands auther.name.”

  • Generate precise OData URLs

    • “Find the service and endpoint for Books via search_model, then give me an OData V4 URL with $select=title,stock and $expand=author($select=name) plus a curl example.”

  • Safely change CDS/annotations

    • “Show docs for @Common.Label using cds‑mcp search_docs. Using search_model for Books, propose a minimal diff adding labels for title and stock. Include file paths.”

  • Plan a refactor

    • “We’re renaming Author to Writer. With cds‑mcp search_model, list affected entities, associations, services, and endpoints; propose a step‑by‑step PR plan.”

  • Implement an action/handler

    • “Find docs on defining and implementing a custom action in Node.js via cds‑mcp search_docs. Then sketch a minimal handler in srv/<service>.js with imports and input validation.”

Best practice: Ask the assistant to paste the search_model and search_docs results that justify any change.

CLI usage (optional but handy)

Install globally to test from your terminal:

npm i -g @cap-js/mcp-server
  • Search your compiled model:
cds-mcp search_model . Books entity
  • Search CAP documentation:
cds-mcp search_docs "how to add columns to a select statement in CAP Node.js" 1

Once the CLI works, your IDE agent can invoke the same tools automatically.

What the tools return

  • search_model

    • Names and kinds (entity, service, etc.)
    • Elements and annotations
    • File locations
    • HTTP endpoints where services are exposed

  • search_docs

    • The most relevant CAP documentation snippets for your query, based on local embeddings

Use both together: discover exact names/paths with search_model, confirm syntax and best practices with search_docs, then apply small, reviewable changes.

Tips for getting the most value

  • Start every task with search_model to avoid typos and stale assumptions.
  • Require docs‑backed edits: have the assistant run search_docs before proposing code.
  • Keep edits atomic: one focused change at a time, with file paths and minimal diffs.
  • Monorepo? Tell the assistant the CAP project folder to search.

Support and contribution

  • Issues and feature requests: https://github.com/cap-js/mcp-server/issues
  • Security policy: https://github.com/cap-js/mcp-server/security/policy
  • Code of Conduct: https://github.com/cap-js/.github/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
  • License and REUSE info: see LICENSE and https://api.reuse.software/info/github.com/cap-js/mcp-server

Now action - 

  • Add the MCP config, paste the two rules into AGENTS.md, and ask your assistant:
    “Discover all entities, keys, and endpoints with cds‑mcp search_model, verify the Node.js SELECT docs with cds‑mcp search_docs, then propose a minimal handler change for Books.”

    SAP Business Technology Platform  SAP Business AI SAP Cloud Application Programming Model

entry.title: Custom tile type creation for OnPremise
entry.content:
Hi All, 

I want to create a tile on the FLP with the radial chart for status, similar to below snap.

I started working towards it, please find further details and my progress below and let me know if I am on the right path and how to resolve it further, any help here would be appreciated?

I am trying to create a custom tile type for FLP. 
My requirement is to show 2 radial charts side by side on the main tile of FLP.

Till now I have created an app in BAS with chip file, registered the chip file and got my custom tile type on the launchpad designer (/ui2/flpd_cust), here it is blank but when I select it, I get my radial charts. (PFB).

                    

Now, the issue I am facing is when I add this tile configuration, all the buttons are greyed out, I am getting only create button enable, so I am not able to see this tile on FLP. 
Also, I tried to implement BADI "/UI2/BADI_FDM_PUB_CUST_TILE", but still all the buttons are disabled. Any help here would be appreciated. 

PS: Documents and blogs referred:
Implementing a Custom Tile Type | SAP Help Portal
Parameters of Interface /UI2/IF_BADI_FDM_PUB_CUST_TILE | SAP Help Portal

SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA SAP Fiori Launchpad SAPUI5 #chip #custom tile type

entry.title: Error fetching SyntaxError: Unexpected token 'N', "Not Found" is not valid JSON
entry.content:
I'm deploying a Fullstack Cloud App uses CAP and SAP UI5 and HANA Cloud. the deployment succeeded but when i try to display data from the API Service that's deployed and working well outside the ui i got that error " Error fetching SyntaxError: Unexpected token 'N', "Not Found" is not valid JSON" How could I resolve It ?
xs-app.json 

{
  "welcomeFile": "/index.html",
  "authenticationMethod": "route",
  "routes": [
     {
      "source": "^/odata/v4/real-estate/(.*)$",
      "target": "/odata/v4/real-estate/$1",
      "destination": "RealEstate-srv-api",
      "authenticationType": "xsuaa",
      "csrfProtection": false
    },
    {
      "source": "^(.*)$",
      "target": "$1",
      "service": "html5-apps-repo-rt",
      "authenticationType": "xsuaa"
    }
   
  ]
}
mta.yml
_schema-version: 3.3.0
ID: RealEstate
description: A simple CAP project.
version: 1.0.0
modules:
- name: RealEstate-srv
  type: nodejs
  path: gen/srv
  requires:
  - name: RealEstate-auth
  - name: RealEstate-db
  provides:
  - name: srv-api
    properties:
      srv-url: ${default-url}
  parameters:
    buildpack: nodejs_buildpack
    instances: 1
  build-parameters:
    builder: npm-ci
- name: RealEstate-db-deployer
  type: hdb
  path: gen/db
  requires:
  - name: RealEstate-db
  parameters:
    buildpack: nodejs_buildpack
- name: RealEstate-destination-content
  type: com.sap.application.content
  requires:
  - name: RealEstate-destination-service
    parameters:
      content-target: true
  - name: RealEstate_html_repo_host
    parameters:
      service-key:
        name: RealEstate_html_repo_host-key
  - name: RealEstate-auth
    parameters:
      service-key:
        name: RealEstate-auth-key
  parameters:
    content:
      instance:
        destinations:
        - Name: RealEstate_approuter_RealEstate_html_repo_host
          ServiceInstanceName: RealEstate-html5-app-host-service
          ServiceKeyName: RealEstate_html_repo_host-key
          sap.cloud.service: RealEstate-approuter
        - Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchange
          Name: RealEstate_approuter_RealEstate_auth
          ServiceInstanceName: RealEstate-auth
          ServiceKeyName: RealEstate-auth-key
          sap.cloud.service: RealEstate-approuter
        existing_destinations_policy: ignore
  build-parameters:
    no-source: true
- name: RealEstate-app-content
  type: com.sap.application.content
  path: .
  requires:
  - name: RealEstate_html_repo_host
    parameters:
      content-target: true
  build-parameters:
    build-result: resources
    requires:
    - artifacts:
      - dboperations.zip
      name: dboperations
      target-path: resources/
- name: dboperations
  type: html5
  path: app/dboperations
  build-parameters:
    build-result: dist
    builder: custom
    commands:
    - npm install
    - npm run build:cf
    supported-platforms: []
resources:
- name: RealEstate-db
  type: com.sap.xs.hdi-container
  parameters:
    service: hana
    service-plan: hdi-shared
- name: RealEstate-auth
  type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
  parameters:
    config:
      tenant-mode: dedicated
      xsappname: RealEstate
    path: ./xs-security.json
    service: xsuaa
    service-plan: application
- name: RealEstate-destination-service
  type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
  parameters:
    config:
      HTML5Runtime_enabled: true
      init_data:
        instance:
          destinations:
          - Authentication: NoAuthentication
            Name: ui5
            ProxyType: Internet
            Type: HTTP
            URL: https://ui5.sap.com
          - Authentication: NoAuthentication
            HTML5.DynamicDestination: true
            HTML5.ForwardAuthToken: true
            Name: RealEstate-srv-api
            ProxyType: Internet
            Type: HTTP
            URL: ~{srv-api/srv-url}
          existing_destinations_policy: update
      version: 1.0.0
    service: destination
    service-name: RealEstate-destination
    service-plan: lite

- name: RealEstate_html_repo_host

parameters:

  enable-parallel-deployments: true
build-parameters:
  before-all:
  - builder: custom
    commands:
    - npm ci
    - npx cds build --production

entry.title: CDS view for the Pegged Requirements List
entry.content:
Greetings,

I have a custom requirement to build a custom application that displays pegged requirement for multiple FG material in single list view, similar to the functionalities available in MD04. In MD04 we can display one material at a time. We need a consolidated view for planning and analysis.

So, is there any CDS views available which I can use that to map this requirement. Please advise on this issue.

Regards,

Rahul

entry.title: billing tax code determination incorrect after saving
entry.content:
hello

 

tax code in billing document is incorrectly redetermined after saving

- determination on sales order- correct 

- determination on billing document before saving- correct

- after saving of billing document material tax code classification is changed and therefor tax code is changed also accordingly condition records maintained

- there is no bapi customized on saving of billing document

- tax code seems to be active/ valid

Please, do ideas why material tax classification could be affected ?

entry.title: SAP Fiori UI5 Personalization Engine event attachStateChange not firing
entry.content:
I'm trying to add a column selection in view settings for sap.m.table

i have the code below where i try to attach the Engine event so when column selected changed, the function is not firing.

All i'm getting is this error - "Log-dbg.js:497 2025-12-09 17:19:39.498800 A Change was not created successfully. Reason: - No Change handler registered for the Control and Change type"

May I know what am I missing?

onInit: function () {
   this.oMetadataHelperPrint = new MetadataHelper(aColumns);

   Engine.getInstance().register(oTable, {
      helper: this.oMetadataHelperPrint,
        controller: {
          Columns: new SelectionController({
             targetAggregation: "columns",
             control: oTable,
             persistenceIdentifier: "selection-columns"
          })
        }
  });

  Engine.getInstance().attachStateChange(this.handleStateChange, this);
},

handleStateChange: function (oEvt) {
  //logic placed here
}

entry.title: value help dropdown itself to show an explicit <empty> option?
entry.content:
I am working with a Value Help based on the annotation:

{
    $Type: 'Common.ValueListParameterIn',
    InitialValueIsSignificant: true,
    LocalDataProperty: id,
    ValueListProperty: 'ID'
}

InitialValueIsSignificant = true works correctly — if the field is empty, the value help filters for id eq '' and returns the correct results.

However, I also need the value help dropdown itself to show an explicit <empty> option, so that the user can actively choose an empty/null value.

Is there a standard way (annotation, UI5 parameter, or OData approach) to include an explicit <empty> option in a Value Help dropdown for a ValueListParameterIn?

entry.content: customer wants to cap their users ( entitlement for RISE) use once they reach their entitlement threshold (100%) . Is there is an alert monitoring feature in SAP 4 Me that a customer can turn on to monitor their RISE consumption or for that matter any license consumption metrics (which is seen in the Consumption tab) ?

entry.title: Insert a New Row into table at a specific Index using Odata v4
entry.content:
Hi Forum,

I have an issue , Please help me in resolving it!!!

When I am trying to create a row with the following code:

// Get the list binding from the table's "items" aggregation
var oListBinding = oTable.getBinding("items");
var oInitialData = {
"site": "1000",
"storage_location":"1234",
"article_doc_num": "1234",
"article_doc_num_itm":"1"
};
// Create a new entry (context)
var oNewContext = oListBinding.create(oInitialData);

The new row is getting created at the beginning of the table, but I want the row to be added at a specific index.


Please suggest a solution for this.

entry.title: HTML5 Application Migrated from NEO to Cloud Foundry Not Visible in BTP / Build Work Zone
entry.content:
We have a basic HTML (SAPUI5) application running on SAP NEO, which we are currently testing to migrate to SAP BTP Cloud Foundry.

We have completed the required configurations on the Cloud Foundry side and updated the following files accordingly:

  • xs-app.json

  • mta.yaml

  • xs-security.json

  • manifest.json

We successfully build the MTAR file and deploy it from SAP Business Application Studio (BAS). The deployment completes without any errors.

However, after deployment:

  • The application does not appear under HTML5 Applications in the SAP BTP cockpit

  • The application is also not visible in SAP Build Work Zone

  • We have already created an instance of HTML5 Application Repository Service with the app-host plan

Could you please help us understand:

  1. What could be the possible reasons for the application not appearing in HTML5 Applications or Build Work Zone?

  2. Are there any mandatory configurations or services (such as app-runtime, destination, XSUAA, or content module settings) that are commonly missed during NEO to Cloud Foundry migration?

  3. Are there any specific checks or logs we should verify after a successful MTAR deployment?

Any guidance or best practices for migrating HTML5 applications from NEO to Cloud Foundry would be greatly appreciated.

mta.yaml:

_schema-version: "3.2"
ID: test.getuserdetailsmta
version: 0.0.1
description: Generated by Fiori Tools

modules:
  - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-app-content
    type: com.sap.application.content
    path: .
    requires:
      - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-repo-host
      #- name: testgetuserdetailsmta-html5-runtime_new
        parameters:
          content-target: true
      - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-destination-service
    build-parameters:
      build-result: resources
      requires:
        - name: testgetuserdetailsmta
          artifacts:
            - dist.zip
          target-path: resources/

  - name: testgetuserdetailsmta
    type: html5
    path: .
    parameters:
      buildpack: nodejs_buildpack
    requires:
      - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-xsuaa
    build-parameters:
      builder: custom
      commands:
        - npm install
        - npm run build:cf
      build-result: dist
      supported-platforms: []

resources:
  - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-repo-host
    type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
    parameters:
      service: html5-apps-repo
      service-plan: app-host
      service-name: testgetuserdetailsmta-html5-service

  # - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-html5-runtime_new
  #   type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
  #   parameters:
  #     service: html5-apps-repo
  #     service-plan: app-runtime
  #     service-name: testgetuserdetailsmta-html5-runtime_new

  - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-destination-service
    type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
    parameters:
      service: destination
      service-plan: lite
      service-name: testgetuserdetailsmta-destination-service
      config:
        HTML5Runtime_enabled: true
        init_data:
          instance:
            destinations:
              - Name: ui5
                URL: https://ui5.sap.com
                Type: HTTP
                ProxyType: Internet
                Authentication: NoAuthentication
            existing_destinations_policy: update
        version: 1.0.0

  - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-xsuaa
    type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
    parameters:
      service: xsuaa
      service-plan: application
      service-name: testgetuserdetailsmta-xsuaa
      config:
        xsappname: testgetuserdetailsmta
        tenant-mode: dedicated
        scopes:
          - name: Display
            description: Display scope

parameters:
  deploy_mode: html5-repo
  enable-parallel-deployments: true

xs-app.json:
{
  "welcomeFile": "/index.html",
  "authenticationMethod": "route",
  "routes": [
    {
      "source": "^<apply-service-segment-path>/(.*)$",
      "target": "<apply-service-segment-path>/$1",
      "destination": "ui5",
      "authenticationType": "xsuaa",
      "csrfProtection": false
    },
    {
      "source": "^/resources/(.*)$",
      "target": "/resources/$1",
      "authenticationType": "none",
      "destination": "ui5"
    },
    {
      "source": "^/test-resources/(.*)$",
      "target": "/test-resources/$1",
      "authenticationType": "none",
      "destination": "ui5"
    },
    {
      "source": "^(.*)$",
      "target": "$1",
      "service": "html5-apps-repo-rt",
      "authenticationType": "xsuaa"
    },
    {
    "source": "^/user-api(.*)",
    "target": "$1",
    "service": "sap-approuter-userapi"
}

  ]
}
xs-security.json:
{
  "xsappname": "test.getuserdetailsmta",
  "tenant-mode": "dedicated",
  "description": "Security profile of called application",
  "scopes": [],
  "role-templates": []
}
ui5-deploy.yaml:
# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://sap.github.io/ui5-tooling/schema/ui5.yaml.json

specVersion: "4.0"
metadata:
  name: test.getuserdetailsmta
type: application
resources:
  configuration:
    propertiesFileSourceEncoding: UTF-8
builder:
  resources:
    excludes:
      - /test/**
      - /localService/**
  customTasks:
    - name: ui5-task-zipper
      afterTask: generateCachebusterInfo
      configuration:
        archiveName: testgetuserdetailsmta
        relativePaths: true
        additionalFiles:
          - xs-app.json
Can anyone assist on this?
 SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry runtime and environment SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition SAPUI5

entry.title: Issues with Joule AI on SAP SuccessFactors Test Instance & Customization of AI Instructions
entry.content:
Issues with Joule AI behavior and customization options

We have tested several times the Joule Joule AI implemented on our SAP SuccessFactor test instance, and we are repeatedly facing error messages such as:

  • “I’m sorry, but I can’t…”

  • "I am unable to ..."
  • “This action is not available at the moment”

(see screenshot attached below)

 

Could you please explain why these messages appear? We would like to understand whether this is related to system configuration, authorizations, current limitations of Joule, or the test environment.

In addition, we would like to know if it is possible to customize Joule’s instructions or responses.
For example, when asking “How can I create a job requisition?”, Joule provides the standard SAP SuccessFactors procedure, whereas we would like it to return our internal company process instead.

Is it possible to modify or configure Joule so that it uses company-specific procedures or documentation rather than the default SAP SuccessFactors guidance?

Finally, could you please let us know how to formally submit or escalate enhancement / evolution requests related to Joule AI (e.g. new functionalities, customization capabilities, or improvements)?

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: Is it possible to take SAP MaxDB Incremental backup during admin mode
entry.content: Can we take SAP MaxDB Incremental backup by maintaining admin mode of the database using third part tool??

entry.title: Datasource corrupted on fresh report
entry.content:
I create a new empty report in crystal report, select the database assistant and connect to a HANA procedure returning a table. If I call that procedure inside the studio with a DocKey and a DocumentID, I get a valid results. However, imediately after entering those same values in CR and hitting "Check dependencies", I get notified that the validation of said table has failed and that the report might be corrupted.

How can this be, what can I do?

BTW, doing the same with another proc'd Table works.

entry.title: Order to Cash Process
entry.content:
Hello,

Please, does SAP S/4 HANA public cloud support the below Order to Cash process and, how can it be implemented:

Sales Order ( with Shipping condition "TM – Int. Planning ")
   ↓
Outbound Delivery
   ↓
Post Goods Issue (Inventory- CR → Good-In-Transit - DR)
   ↓
Proof of Delivery (POD)
   ↓
GIT → COGS (Cr - Goods-In-Transit    DR - COGS )
   ↓
Billing (Revenue Recognition) (Revenue and Trade Receivable)
